result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Moses Jamal Vazquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Moses Jamal Vazquez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Moses Jamal Vazquez was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Moses Jamal Vazquez was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Pay costs of supervision and court costs.  The Court has imposed the $200 DNA surcharge on Count 3 but remitted it on Count 4.

Engage in any counseling or treatment as ordered by the agent.  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any/all required programs.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Moses to Judge and Judge's letter in response
Def's date of birth:  2-2-86

Email from P/P - def's date of birth is 2-2-86; request that JOC be amended/corrected.  Clerk has asked for clarification from RCSD dispatch.  Per RCSD dispatcher N Collins, the correct date of birth is 2-2-86.  JOC will be amended/corrected to reflect this information.
Diversion Agreement

ADA Forehand, Def, and Atty. McDougal.  Atty. M informs the court that the parties have an agreement for resolution which includes the amendment of the felony in count 1 to 948.03(3)(b).  Count 1 amended.  Count 4 also amended - to 943.01 - criminal damage to property.

Def pleads no contest to Count 1, 3, and 4.  Court's colloquy re pleas.  Finding of guilty.  

Court approves 12 mo diversion agreement on count 1.  On counts 3 and 4, sentence withheld for 2 years probation.  Pay costs, DNA surcharge required for count 3, engage in any counseling or treatment as ordered by the agent (attend/succ. complete/pay for).  DNA surcharge imposed and remitted on count 4.

Def's bond will continue - any special conditions to be dropped.
Status conference on May 21, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court with Defendant Moses Jamal Vazquez. Prosecuting Atty Amy E Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Information has not been filed. Atty M. Requests this matter be set over.  Status conference scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

ADA Forehand for the State. Def appears in person and with counsel, Atty Lisa McDougal. Atty M. states def waives his preliminary hearing. Court's colloquy on waiver of prelim. Accepts waiver, binds def over for trial. ADA requests bond be amended to strike the provision that he not be allowed at his sister's home. No objection by def. Bond is amended. Set for arraignment on May 5 @ 9.
Preliminary hearing on April 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Per JA instant message from court: Judge is moving Mr. Vazquez criminal case from 4/16/14 to 4/14/14 at 9:00 a.m. along with the (other) case.
Preliminary hearing on April 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. McDougal.  Formal reading has already been waived.  Atty. M states that the def is also waiving the prelim time limits but requests prelim scheduling.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-16-2014 at 09:00 am.

Signature bond is amended.

b. The defendant shall have no violent or abusive contact with Kim Carney. 
c. The defendant shall not be at the residence of Kim Carney, unless there is a scheduled visitation with SV and JS arranged by RCHHS. All other conditions of the previous bail bond remain in effect.
